questions.question: What does a red traffic light mean?
options: Stop and wait behind the stop line
Slow down and proceed with caution
Speed up to clear the intersection
questions.explanation: A red traffic light means you must stop and wait behind the stop line until the light turns green.

questions.question: What is the national speed limit on a single carriageway?
questions.explanation: The national speed limit on a single carriageway is 60 mph for cars.

questions.question: When should you use your hazard warning lights?
options: When parking on double yellow lines
To warn others of a hazard ahead
When driving slowly in fast traffic
questions.explanation: Hazard warning lights should be used to warn other drivers of a hazard or obstruction ahead.
